introduction: The following text is from Around the World in Eighty Days by Jules Verne (1872). Phileas Fogg, an English gentleman, has made a wager that he can travel around the world in eighty days.
text: The idea of traveling around the world in such a short time seemed nearly impossible to everyone who heard it. Yet, Mr. Fogg, with his calm and unyielding confidence, believed it could be done. With only a few essentials packed, he set off on his journey with his loyal servant, Passepartout. Determined and unfazed by the challenges he might face, Mr. Fogg knew that his success depended not only on speed but on maintaining a precise and unrelenting schedule.
question: Which choice best states the main idea of the text?
A: Mr. Fogg’s journey is widely supported by those around him.
B: The journey requires an enormous amount of supplies and resources.
C: Mr. Fogg’s confidence and planning are crucial to his attempt.
D: Passepartout is uncertain about Mr. Fogg’s travel plans.
explanation: B is the best answer because the text emphasizes Mr. Fogg’s calm confidence and determination to stick to a strict schedule, which are presented as essential to his plan for success.Choice A is incorrect because there is no indication that others support Mr. Fogg’s journey; rather, it seems most people doubt the feasibility of his plan. Choice C is incorrect because the text doesn’t mention any uncertainty from Passepartout about Mr. Fogg’s plans. Choice D is incorrect because the passage suggests that Mr. Fogg only brings a few essentials, so extensive supplies and resources are not a focus.
